Empires & Puzzles Ceris Review: The Astral Dwarf Magus

Ceris isn't just another brick in the wall; she's an Astral Dwarf with a penchant for shutting down conversations—permanently. With a 6-turn silence and a nasty chain reaction that hunts mana-rich enemies, she's the librarian of the battlefield: Shhh!
Ceris: The Silence of the Lamps (and Manabars)
Ceris: The Astral Librarian Who Silences the Competition

Ceris is a Legendary Fire hero from the Astral Dwarfs family, joining the roster in early 2025. She operates as a high-impact tactical nuker, designed to punish enemy teams that get too greedy with their mana. With a special skill that can chain through enemies and leave them silenced for an agonizingly long duration, she controls the flow of battle by simply saying "No" to enemy specials. While she might look like she's about to knit you a sweater or scold you for running in the halls, her "Spell-lock" is a terrifying disciplinary action.

The artwork for the Astral Dwarfs often leans into a cosmic, somewhat ethereal aesthetic mixed with sturdy dwarven features. Ceris is no exception, sporting a look that some might affectionately describe as "Space Grandma" or a "Snobby Soccer Mom with celestial powers." She levitates a complex, armillary sphere-like device, suggesting she's more interested in the mechanics of the universe (and dismantling your team's stats) than swinging an axe. The color palette is rich with reds and cosmic purples, fitting her Fire element and Astral origin. It's a refreshing departure from the typical "angry warrior yelling at a cloud" pose.

Ceris boasts a modern stat line that leans heavily towards survivability while maintaining a respectable attack. With over 1200 defense and nearly 2100 health in her base form, she is built to endure the initial volley of attacks so she can fire off her devastating control skill. Compared to the absolute latest power creep (like the Mahayoddha family heroes released in late 2025), her stats are slightly behind the bleeding edge but remain firmly in the top tier. She is tanky enough to withstand the current meta's damage dealers and hits hard enough to matter.
"Spell-lock" is a complex, condition-based skill that acts as a hard counter to mana generation.
It starts with a massive 600% snipe. This alone is enough to threaten most glass cannons.

This is where the magic happens. If the target has over 50% mana, Ceris hunts for the next victim who also has over 50% mana. This chain mechanic punishes teams that are charged or nearly charged, turning their own momentum against them.

A 6-turn silence on all hit targets is arguably the most powerful part of her kit. Most silences last 2-3 turns; six turns is an eternity in Empires & Puzzles. It essentially removes those heroes from the match for a full cycle of turns.
Applying a -350 Attack and Defense wither to
enemies (not just hit ones) softens up the entire opposing team and neuters their return fire.
Average. She needs 10 tiles to fire (9 with a level 23 mana troop, or fewer with other bonuses).
The damage reduces, but even a reduced hit applies the critical Silence and Wither.
6 Turns. This denies the enemy special skills for potentially 30-40% of a typical match duration.

-350 Attack/Defense is a permanent reduction until the battle ends or stats are recovered/overwritten (depending on Wither mechanics interactions). This drastically swings the attrition war in your favor.
Family Bonus, Passives, Aether Power & Unique Abilities
The Astral Dwarfs come with a kit designed for consistency and countering modern annoyances.

The chance to dispel a buff from all enemies at the end of every turn is a subtle but powerful disruption. While 25% (with 2 heroes) isn't reliable enough to plan your entire strategy around, it will randomly strip Taunts, Dodge buffs, or HoTs when you least expect it, often swinging a match.

This is crucial in a minion-heavy meta. Ceris ignores the meat shields and hits the hero directly, ensuring her damage trigger conditions (checking enemy mana) aren't foiled by a minion absorbing the hit.
She laughs at Goblin withers or other minion-based ailments.
Blindness is not an option. She will land her Silence.
A 20% boost at the start helps ensure that her first 600% hit secures a kill or brings the target into critical range.

Upon release, Ceris was immediately identified as a tactical powerhouse. Her ability to silence for such a long duration drew comparisons to other top-tier mana controllers, but with the added lethality of a sniper.

While raw stats increase monthly, the utility of a 6-turn silence and permanent Wither does not age quickly. 600% damage is still a very high multiplier for an Average speed hero that hits multiple targets.

Ceris remains highly viable in all top-tier PvP modes. She serves as a potent counter to Rush teams and passive-heavy defenses where mana generation is high. She is not just a collector's item; she is a war machine.
There are two schools of thought for Ceris: maximizing her kill potential or ensuring she survives to cast her devastating silence.
Maximizes survivability, ensuring she lives long enough to fire her Average speed skill. The Wither and Silence are her main utility, not just the raw damage.
The 600% hit, while strong, might fail to one-shot tankier enemies without attack investment.
Leans into her 600% multiplier. Makes her a lethal sniper who
Slightly squishier, risking death before she can punish the enemy team.

path is recommended. 600% is a massive multiplier, and in modern E&P, dead enemies are the best form of crowd control. However, if you use her primarily for the Silence/Wither utility in a support role, Defense is a valid choice.
6 turns of Silence is oppressive and game-winning.
Specifically targets enemies who are dangerous (high mana).
The Wither effect (-350 Atk/Def) cripples the enemy team permanently, making them hit like wet noodles and fold like paper.
If the enemy team has low mana, she acts as a single-target sniper. She requires the enemy to be somewhat set up to achieve her maximum potential.
Average speed means she isn't a "save me now" button like a Fast or Very Fast hero. She needs time to charge.
While Wither is permanent/stacking, the Silence can be cleansed (if the cleanser isn't the one silenced).
Exceptional, especially against teams that rely on timing multiple specials together.
She becomes Very Fast, meaning she can silence the enemy team before they can fire their devastating rush skills.
A fantastic offensive tool to break defensive formations.
Ceris shines when she is the second or third hero to fire, or when paired with mana manipulators.
Pair Ceris with other mana controllers (like Waterpipe or Roughian & Nurgib). Keep the enemy mana suppressed, and when they do creep above 50%, slam them with Ceris.
Pair with other Wither heroes (like Darkfeather or Acidfire). Stack the attack/defense reduction so high that the enemy becomes harmless.
Place her on the flank in Rush wars. If she fires, the 6-turn silence essentially ends the match for the attacker.
Heroes who block ailments (Aron, Hathor, Garnet) are her biggest enemies. If she can't land the Silence, she loses a massive chunk of her utility.
Passive resistance to ailments is the bane of Ceris's existence. Hitting a Toon and having the Silence "Resisted" feels bad.
Don't pair her with heroes who completely drain mana to zero (like Hel or Proteus)
she fires, or her chain mechanic won't trigger. You want the enemy to have

If you are lucky enough to pull Ceris early, she will carry you through map stages and raids. Her silence shuts down bosses completely. Prioritize getting her to 3/70 immediately, and she is 100% worth the Rings for final ascension.

Ceris is a "thinking player's" hero. She requires reading the board and enemy mana bars. She is worth Limit Breaking (LB1) for the stat boost. LB2 is justified if you lack other top-tier Fire control heroes, as the Attack Up aether power synergizes well with her high damage multiplier. However, be mindful of the "Toon Meta"—her value drops slightly against teams with high passive resistance.
The community reaction to Ceris was a mix of awe at her kit and amusement at her design.
Players joked that she looks like she's about to hand out orange slices or yell at a referee, but her gameplay is anything but gentle.
Many compared her mechanics to Lemonwood, noting the similar "punish high mana" chain, but with the added nastiness of Silence.

Initially seen as strong in beta, her transition to live (with tweaks to speed and effect durations) cemented her status as a "must-have" for many. The jump to a 6-turn silence in data files (vs the standard 3-4) shocked many theory-crafters.

Ceris is a hero who demands respect. She doesn't just damage enemies; she dismantles their ability to fight back. By combining high burst damage, long-duration silence, and permanent stat degradation, she is a triple-threat powerhouse. While she may not have the flashy speed of a Ninja, her impact on the board is undeniable. If you see her on defense, bring a cleanser. If you have her on offense, enjoy the sound of silence.
An excellent addition to any roster, offering unique control mechanics that age like fine wine.
